title: NASA Mission to Study Ice Clouds, Help Observe Our Dynamic Atmosphere
summary: NASA has selected a new mission to help humanity better understand Earth’s dynamic atmosphere – specifically, ice clouds that form at high altitudes throughout tropical and sub-tropical regions. The PolSIR instrument – short for Polarized Submillimeter Ice-cloud Radiometer – will study such ice clouds to determine how and why they change throughout

title: OneWeb announces Innovation Challenge Winners
summary: OneWeb announced six finalists May 22 for its annual Innovation Challenge.

title: Exploration Upper Stage Unveiled: Revolutionary Leap in Crew Safety, Cargo Capacity, and Deep Space Power
summary: After Artemis I launched in November 2022 atop the only super heavy-lift rocket capable of carrying crew and large cargo to deep space in a single lift, James Savage went […]

title: DARPA selects Umbra to demonstrate radar imaging techniques
summary: Umbra won a contract from the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency to demonstrate novel collection techniques using synthetic aperture radar satellites, the company announced May 22.

title: SpaceX delivers private Axiom crew to the space station, carrying Saudi astronauts
summary: SpaceX delivered another quartet of astronauts to the International Space Station on Monday morning, on a private flight that included government astronauts from Saudi Arabia as the Arab kingdom leverages U.S. companies to expands its ambitions in space.

title: Former NGA director Robert Cardillo joins Synthetaic’s board of directors
summary: Synthetaic, a startup that uses artificial intelligence to analyze data from space and air sensors, announced May 22 that former director of the National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency Robert Cardillo has joined its board of directors.

title: SpaceX launches 10th crewed mission, third fully commercial flight
summary: SpaceX has rapidly become the world's most prolific human spaceflight provider.

title: Impact Observatory unveils IO Monitor
summary: Impact Observatory unveiled an early access program May 22 for IO Monitor, the Washington-based company’s global mapping and monitoring product.

title: Defending Taiwan by countering China’s biggest threat
summary: China’s anti-satellite capabilities are not the biggest threat to GPS. What should be much more of a concern to U.S. policymakers is that China relies far less on space for critical GPS-like services than we do.

title: China launches new science probes, SAR sat and replacement Beidou satellite
summary: China conducted a pair of launches last week to replenish its Beidou navigation system and send science and radar tech test satellites into orbit.
